benchmark_details.name: KPMath (Key-Point-Driven Mathematics Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: KPMath is a synthetic dataset tailored for mathematical reasoning, comprising over 800K question-answer pairs. It utilizes a novel Key-Point-Driven Data Synthesis framework to enhance the quality and diversity of mathematical questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale, high-quality dataset for training language models on mathematical reasoning tasks.

data.source: Generated through a data synthesis framework (Key-Point-Driven Data Synthesis) leveraging existing mathematical datasets including MATH and GSM8K.
data.annotation: Automatically generated with quality assessments through consensus scoring.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by evaluating model predictions on test sets like GSM8K and MATH.
methodology.interpretation: High PASS@1 accuracy indicates effective performance in mathematical reasoning.
methodology.baseline_results: The fine-tuned Qwen1.5-72B model achieved 87.0% PASS@1 accuracy on GSM8K and 58.3% on MATH.
methodology.validation: Validation performed by testing on multiple established math reasoning datasets.
